articles.author: Khanh Vu, Minh Nguyen
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said during a state visit to Vietnam on Thursday that strengthening strategic ties is "one of his priorities" as he continued a swing through Asia seen as a show of defiance.
articles.title: Russia's Putin in Vietnam calls for strengthening "strategic partnership"

articles.author: Jack Kim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: North Korea and Russia agreed to provide immediate military assistance if the other side faced armed aggression, under a pact their leaders signed during Russian President Vladimir Putin's first visit in 24 years.
articles.title: North Korea, Russia sign pact to give all available military help if other is attacked

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded areas in the central Gaza Strip overnight, killing three people and wounding dozens of others, according to medics, while tanks deepened their invasion into Rafah in the south, residents said.
articles.title: Israel pounds central Gaza camps, deepens invasion of Rafah

articles.author: Abdi Sheikh, Aaron Ross, Giulia Paravicini
articles.description: Somalia's government is seeking to slow the withdrawal of African peacekeepers and warning of a potential security vacuum, documents seen by Reuters show, with neighbouring countries fretting that resurgent al Shabaab militants could seize power.
articles.title: Exclusive: Somalia asks peacekeepers to slow withdrawal, fears Islamist resurgence

articles.author: Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: The United States and China were set to hold high-level talks on anti-narcotics cooperation on Thursday, following a breakthrough in bilateral work this week that saw them jointly go after a major drug-linked money laundering operation.
articles.title: US, China to hold high-level talks on anti-narcotics cooperation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Chinese foreign ministry said on Thursday that exiled spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism the Dalai Lama must "thoroughly correct" his political views as a condition for contact with China's central government to resume.
articles.title: China says Dalai Lama must 'thoroughly correct' his political views

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian-American woman arrested earlier this year while visiting family in Russia went on trial for alleged treason on Thursday after authorities accused her of raising money to send to the Ukrainian army.
articles.title: Russian-American woman goes on trial for treason after donating funds to Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 530 Egyptians have died taking part in the haj and another 31 are missing as extreme heat hits the annual Muslim pilgrimage to Mecca, medical and security sources told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: Toll of Egyptians who died during haj pilgrimage rises, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Poland will probably sign a contract with South Korea in September for the delivery of more arms, in particular K2 tanks, Defence Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz was quoted as saying on Thursday by the state news agency PAP.
articles.title: Poland likely to sign another arms deal with S.Korea, minister says
People in Serbia, Montenegro advised to shelter indoors from heatwave
